intro: Xylopia pseudolemurica, commonly known as the Madagascar xylopia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. Xylopia pseudolemurica is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a habitat and food source for local wildlife.
